column4: I looked at the boot options page, but I'm not sure which one to add...
But I do think there is a problem with SATA because it will not load the installer on the LiveCD or text based installer
Jaunty
What is this about a generic-ide boot option? I don't see that one in BootOptions page
Am I the only one who has ran into this problem with the Live CD not booting or the text based installer?
I mean there should be a failsafe or something to at least get Ubuntu to boot
It is annoying to have to do hit the power button on my computer because it won't exit
Anyone?  I have been trying to get Ubuntu to install for several hours now.  I'm tired and I can't seem to get anything working.
what's the problem?
is there a specific problem or error or any more info?
what hardware and bios?
> https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/209454/comments/28
> https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/209454/comments/28
just add the kernel param I just linked you too and see if that works
we wont know until you try
scunizi seems to verify the adivce I gave to you as being tested and working on some hardware
hit f6 at the first screen on the live cd, not sure where to do it on the alternative installer
use the live cd and add the kernel param, that should then work
god damm.. I KNOW IT IS A SATA ISSUE. and I gave you the fix
you'll have to use google to see if you can add kernel params on the alt installer, I dont think you can though
the kernel parameter will bypass the sata issue
get the live cd, add the kernel parameter by pressing f6 at the first screen, then it will work fine./
